New Records: Shaheen Afridi picked up 4-22, and Muhammad Haris scored 31
Key Match Events: Muhammad Haris dances down the track, goes for the cut, but the ball is pouched by Nasum Ahmed at backward point.
Shan Masood smacked Shakib Al Hasan through the on-side for another boundary.
Pakistan are potentially one blow away from the win.
Pakistan only need two to win but Iftikhar Ahmed has gone for an ugly heave the flies into the air and Najmul Hossain Shanto takes a smart catch.
Pre-Game Insights: Pakistan captain Babar Azam: 'The pitch is not easy to bat on. It was a little bit two-paced. Me and Mohammad Rizwan decided to go long but unfortunately we didn't go much further. But it was good to see Muhammad Haris show some aggression.'
Post-Match Reflections: Bangladesh skipper Shakib Al Hasan: 'Of course at the halfway stage we wanted to get somewhere between 145 runs. That would've been more reasonable. The second overs were really difficult.'
Player of the match Shaheen Shah Afridi: 'It's not easy to come back after injury and bowl I am just trying to bowl my best.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game goes on. Trying to finish in style but it's straight into the hands of the fielder.
The permutations: South Africa are out after their shock defeat to the Netherlands, which also means India are through.
Others: Pakistan began the Super 12s with back-to-back defeats but now find themselves in the semi-finals. Amazing. They are actually top of Group 2 as it stands, though India can win the group if they beat Zimbabwe later this morning.
